psalm.text:
[[Ps 7,2]]O LORD, my God, in you I take refuge; 
save me from all my pursuers and rescue me,
[[Ps 7,3]]Lest I become like the lion's prey, 
to be torn to pieces, with no one to rescue me.

[[Ps 7,9b]]Do me justice, O LORD, because I am just,
[[Ps 7,9c]]and because of the innocence that is mine.
[[Ps 7,10]]Let the malice of the wicked come to an end, 
but sustain the just, 
O searcher of heart and soul, O just God.

[[Ps 7,11]]A shield before me is God, 
who saves the upright of heart;
[[Ps 7,12]]A just judge is God, 
a God who punishes day by day.
psalm.title: Psalms

first_reading.text:
[[Jr 11,18]]I knew their plot because the LORD informed me; at that time you, O LORD, showed me their doings.
[[Jr 11,19]]Yet I, like a trusting lamb led to slaughter, had not realized that they were hatching plots against me: "Let us destroy the tree in its vigor; let us cut him off from the land of the living, so that his name will be spoken no more."
[[Jr 11,20]]But, you, O Lord of hosts, O just Judge, searcher of mind and heart, Let me witness the vengeance you take on them, for to you I have entrusted my cause!
first_reading.title: Book of Jeremiah

gospel.text:
[[Jn 7,40]]Some in the crowd who heard these words of Jesus said, "This is truly the Prophet."
[[Jn 7,41]]Others said, "This is the Messiah." But others said, "The Messiah will not come from Galilee, will he?
[[Jn 7,42]]Does not scripture say that the Messiah will be of David's family and come from Bethlehem, the village where David lived?"
[[Jn 7,43]]So a division occurred in the crowd because of him.
[[Jn 7,44]]Some of them even wanted to arrest him, but no one laid hands on him.
[[Jn 7,45]]So the guards went to the chief priests and Pharisees, who asked them, "Why did you not bring him?"
[[Jn 7,46]]The guards answered, "Never before has anyone spoken like this one."
[[Jn 7,47]]So the Pharisees answered them, "Have you also been deceived?
[[Jn 7,48]]Have any of the authorities or the Pharisees believed in him?
[[Jn 7,49]]But this crowd, which does not know the law, is accursed."
[[Jn 7,50]]Nicodemus, one of their members who had come to him earlier, said to them,
[[Jn 7,51]]Does our law condemn a person before it first hears him and finds out what he is doing?
[[Jn 7,52]]They answered and said to him, "You are not from Galilee also, are you? Look and see that no prophet arises from Galilee."
[[Jn 7,53]]Then each went to his own house,
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint John
